aicpa-topic.title: Compliance or Exemption Report Required by SEC Rule 17a-5

body.p: 3.156 Compliance report. For a broker-dealer that does not make a claim of exemption from SEC Rule 15c3-3 throughout the most recent fiscal year or otherwise file an exemption report, concurrent with the filing of the annual audited financial report, the broker-dealer files a compliance report. The compliance report should be accompanied by an examination report issued by the independent auditor. If the examination report of the independent public accountant identifies one or more material weaknesses, the broker-dealer is required to make certain notifications to its customers and the report is made available for the customer’s inspection at the principal and regional office (for the region in which the broker-dealer has its principal place of business) of the SEC.

3.157 Exemption report. For a broker-dealer that claims an exemption from SEC Rule 15c3-3 throughout the most recent fiscal year (or is not otherwise required to file a compliance report based on SEC guidance), concurrent with the filing of the annual audited financial report, the broker-dealer files an exemption report. This exemption report should be accompanied by a review report issued by the independent auditor.

3.158 During the course of the audit, if the independent auditor determines that an instance of noncompliance with the financial responsibility rules or material weakness (as defined by SEC Rule 17a-5) exists, the auditor should immediately call it to the attention of the CFO of the broker-dealer, who then has the responsibility of informing the SEC within one business day, under certain circumstances pursuant to SEC Rule 17a-5 and/or 17a-11. If a required notification to the SEC does not occur, the auditor has the responsibility of informing the SEC. See paragraphs 3.41 and 3.110 for further discussion.
